required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Smart Walk: A Physical Activity Program for African American Women
clinical_study.official_title: Smart Walk: A Physical Activity Program for African American Women

collaborator.agency: National Heart, Lung, and Blood Institute (NHLBI)

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this project is to test an 8-month, culturally relevant, Smartphone-delivered PA program to improve and maintain high physical levels and reduce cardiometabolic disease risk among obese AA women.

detailed_description.textblock: A three-phase study will be used to refine and implement an established theory-based culturally relevant physical activity promotion intervention for obese African American women. Phase 1 (Aim 1a) will include formative research where 25 African American women provide feedback (via 9 focus groups) to further refine the physical activity intervention by specifying the deep structure cultural relevance of the theoretical mediators of self-regulation, self-efficacy, social support, behavioral capability, and outcome expectations.5 Phase 2 will focus on technical development of the refined culturally tailored intervention and 1-month demonstration trial of the Smartphone-delivered physical activity promotion program. Phase 3 (Aims 1b and 1c) will test the intervention and delivery strategy in a two-arm randomized trial where 60 sedentary, obese African American women will receive either the 8-month culturally relevant smartphone-delivered physical activity intervention or a 8-month wellness contact control condition

primary_outcome.measure: Change in physical activity from baseline to 8-months
Feasibility and acceptability of the Smartphone delivered physical activity program
primary_outcome.description: Feasibility and acceptability will be assessed by examining recruitment, retention, adherence, self-reported treatment acceptance, and participant utilization of the Smartphone application provided by analytic tracking software.

secondary_outcome.measure: change in body mass index (BMI) from baseline to 8-months
change in cardiorespiratory fitness from baseline to 8-months
secondary_outcome.description: A modified Balke treadmill protocol will be used to estimate aerobic capacity (VO2peak).

secondary_outcome.measure: change in Aortic Pulse Wave Velocity from baseline to 8-months
secondary_outcome.description: A measure of aortic stiffness, will be assessed with SphymocorTM using validated methodology

secondary_outcome.measure: change in blood pressure from baseline to 8-months
change in total serum cholesterol from baseline to 8-months
change in serum high-density lipoprotein (HDL) from baseline to 8-months
change in serum low-density lipoprotein (LDL) from baseline to 8-months
change in serum triglycerides from baseline to 8-months
change in serum insulin from baseline to 8-months
secondary_outcome.description: measured using Immulite 1000 immunoassay analyzer (Siemens Healthcare Diagnostics)

secondary_outcome.measure: change in insulin sensitivity from baseline to 8-months
secondary_outcome.description: assessed by calculating homeostatic model assessment (HOMA) scores as: glucose (mg/dl) x insulin (Î¼U/ml)/405.

secondary_outcome.measure: change in tumor necrosis factor alpha from baseline to 8-months
change in Interleukin 1 beta from baseline to 8-months

arm_group.description: A culturally relevant physical activity promotion program delivered using a Smartphone application.
A wellness contract control condition delivered using a Smartphone application.

intervention.description: A Smartphone delivered physical activity program
A Smartphone delivered wellness intervention focused on topics other than physical activity (e.g., skin care, oral health, and breast exams).

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Self-reported African American
- Insufficiently Active (< 60 mins of PA per wk measured by Exercise Vital Sign Questionnaire)
- BMI>30
- English speaking and reading
- Own non-Kindle Smartphone iOS 7 or above, or Android 2.3 or above
Exclusion Criteria:
- Concurrent participation in another physical activity, nutrition, or weight loss program
- Endorsement of an item on the Physical Activity Readiness Questionnaire (PAR-Q)
- Pregnant or plans to become pregnant in next 12 months
- Plans to relocate out of Phoenix area in next 12 months
